intro: Manilkara multinervis subsp. schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African manilkara, is a tropical tree native to central and western Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces yellowish-orange fruits that contain a single large seed, and it is known for its aromatic, milky latex. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
